website_summaries.verdict: This rugged trike adjusts in size as your child grows. It's listed for children as young as two, but its size makes it a better choice for kids who are a little older.
pros: Adjustable seat allows tricycle to grow with your child
Pedals are slip-resistant and easily adjustable to feet with removable blocks
cons: Children who are short for their age may have difficulty reaching the pedals

customer_reviews.title: False advertising...
customer_reviews.text: C'mon, what 2 year old is possibly reaching these pedals? My close to 3 year old daughter was super psyched about this, but stands no chance of reaching the pedals anytime soon, and she's close to 80th percentile in height. This is almost false advertising, as it should be labeled as 3-5 year olds, unless your 2 year old is literally one of the tallest two year olds in the country. Yes she can "Flinstone" it, but at her age, that's not what she wants to do. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.  Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but Solid - Tons of Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter loves this!! She's already 36" tall, and can barely touch the pedals at their farthest point - shame the seat doesn't adjust forward more. Other than that, she has no problems maneuvering it, even with it's size, it's very light and she was comfortable on it almost instantly (her first tricycle). Does well on hardwood floors, tile floors, carpets, and sidewalks/street. Struggles a bit on grass, of course. Recommended - but make sure your kid is big enough. Still plenty of room for my toddler to grow into.
customer_reviews.author: Makboz

customer_reviews.title: They were fairly easy to put together and seem sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my twins. They were fairly easy to put together and seem sturdy. My twins are 2 and of average height/size and are having a hard time reaching the pedals, even with the extenders on. I wouldn't necessarily say this is a bad thing, they use their feet to move around and I hope this means the trikes will last longer/grow with them longer. They work great in our house on the carpet and hard wood floors however, outside on the sidewalk/driveway the plastic wheels tend to not grip as well and then don't turn smoothly all the time. All in all, my kids love these bikes so it is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: AmazingAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used this trike almost every day for almost a year and she has run it to death, and it still works great. For being made of plastic it's a good little trike. I really wanted a Schwinn made of metal with air filled tires but I thought that may be overkill for a 3 year old, so we got this, and we haven't regretted it. I especially love the low center of gravity - she has not tipped it once. And she makes fast, sharp turns in it (little thrill seeker o.o) and it stays, all three wheels on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2 year old daughter for Christmas because she asked for a purple tricycle. I was a little skeptical of this one but my daughter insisted on purple and it was the only purple one I could find so we purchased it. I'm so glad we did, she absolutely loves it! I love that the seat and pedals can be adjusted, an awesome feature! The tricycle was very simple to put together by myself in a matter of minutes. It rides very smoothly and after 3 months of having it now she is still just as in love with it as she was on Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bday present
customer_reviews.text: We got this bike for my 3 year old and didn't put the pedal stoppers on, but she probably could use them. The bike is super cute and seems to work just fine. The package arrived quickly and in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trike, Stretch to Pedals
customer_reviews.text: My 3-year-old really likes this trike. Somehow it's still a stretch for her to reach the pedals, even with the adjustments. She goes around on it Flintstones style, with her feet on the floor. She'll grow into it and love it, I know. Easy/fun to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Happy daughter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's birthday. The box was a little banged up, but it arrived on time. The assembly looked taxing at first, but was really easy. It is plastic, but it's a hardy material that will last. My daughter loves it and that's all that matters. Good value and happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: TheLovingBuddha

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Child loves this bike. Very easy to put together. Age 2.5 right now and can almost reach the pedals but can still scoot around and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: AWDV8

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I expected her to be a little big for this because she's tall for her age but the seat goes back far enough to get years out of this, the tires are plastic and I'm a little worried about rocks and stuff damaging it but she's ridden it everyday for hours and it's been fine, the pedals do seem to slip every once in a while and I'm not sure why but I haven't found a solution to it yet, overall its been amazing especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: A little to big but easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t read the reviews before I had my mom order this for my daughter for Christmas. A lot of people complain about it being to big for a 2, and they are right. My daughter is tall for her age. She is two and wears 3/4t pants. She is still to short to reach the pedals. That’s my only complaint. She loves riding around the house (think flint stone style) and it’ll give her more time to use it. It was really easy to put together too!
customer_reviews.author: talynn

customer_reviews.title: Front wheel slips
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this trike for my 3 1/2 year old Granddaughter. It fits her fine. Problem is that the front wheel does not grip the riding surface (driveway/road) well and this results in the front wheel spinning and my Granddaughter getting frustrated. She has used it a couple of times on the sidewalk and I have ended up pushing her to keep it moving. If a corrosive strip could be added to the front wheel to provide a better grip on the riding surface, I think this problem would be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carner

customer_reviews.title: Awkward shaped
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago for Christmas for my (at the time) 2 year old. She is now 3 and even with the extra foot pedals, can't reach. It doesn't ride on carpet well, or wood floor for that matter. We haven't tried outside because, well, she's still too small for it. *she's in the 70th-90% percentile for height & weight*
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not for an average height two year old (or possibly even three year old)
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this product. I purchased this for my almost three year old (because it is recommended for 2 to 5 year olds) and even with the seat moved all the way forward she cannot reach the pedals well enough to pedal. She was super excited to receive the bicycle and sits on it and uses her feet to move around a bit but she is still left out just watching the bigger kids ride around. Hopefully next summer she will be able to really use it!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Stec

customer_reviews.title: Works well for now
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it. The steering wheel is overly tough to turn but it hasn't been bothering my 2 year old. The rear axle goes right against plastic, it won't last long in hot areas with long use. It would be nice if the metal on the pedals were a little longer. Aveeno with the extenders they're a little shorter than ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D Crown

customer_reviews.title: Overall would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great tri-cycle but even as a tall 3 year old the pedals are still pretty much out of reach for our daughter. If she slides forward she can reach them with the covers on. She will be able to grow into this bike and really likes it. Easy to assemble but some of the pieces weren't very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Pinion

customer_reviews.title: much like most in our family
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loves this trike despite not being able to touch the pedals yet. She is two years old and has kind of short legs...long in the torso, much like most in our family. She has no problem pushing herself around on it by scooting along so she can feel like one of the older kids. It won't be long and one day she will reach the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: JulianeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: petals were hard for my daughter's feet to stay on ...
customer_reviews.text: petals were hard for my daughter's feet to stay on. she's a tall 2 year old and very coordinated, but had trouble. after a while she got the hang of it, but had to attach a pole on the back to push her when she would get stuck which happened a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was very easily able to put it together and brought it over ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my 2 yr old niece. I was very easily able to put it together and brought it over to her house. She couldn't reach the pedals even with the extra blocks but she zoomed around anyway. She rides it all throughout the house in winter and brings it outside on nice days!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to my 2-year-old granddaughter. It was VERY easy for her dad to put together, and she really enjoys playing on it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Age range seems a bit off, as my (fairly ...
customer_reviews.text: Age range seems a bit off, as my (fairly tall) 2-year old niece can not reach the pedals. She still enjoys it and walks around with it, and hopefully will reach the pedals soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Hassan

customer_reviews.title: For toddlers...NOT so great til their feet reach and they pedal!
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many reviews about how the 2year olds can grow into them and they're perfect for that reason, I only read ONE review out of 20+ that said (rather emphatically, which I should have listened to) that when the toddlers cannot reach the pedals at first, they're little feet get run over - consistently and constantly - by the back wheels. Definite design flaw. They are cute, light and simple to assemble. But who wants their children's (or better yet, grandchildren's) feet run over. It clips their heels. I would like to give only 2 stars but will rate it 3
customer_reviews.author: Lynda E

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This bike is such a disappointment. My 4 year old is easily able to reach the pedals, but because the wheel is smooth, it doesn't move. She can only make it move by putting her feet on the ground and walking it. I'm so mad that I spent the money on it and it's cheap garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Donna Rae Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is almost 3, can almost touch the petals. Wish this was designed differently so the seat wasn’t so far away or was adjustable or something. Also, the removable training petals that come with this are a joke. They went in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So cute but very big
customer_reviews.text: This trike was for my 2yo daughter for Christmas and she is on the smaller side and this trike was really big for her. She'll probably have to wait a few months to reach it better
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Williams

customer_reviews.title: More for a 3 yo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old. It’s definitely more for a three year old. She’s 95 percentile in height and could not reach the pedals. The durability seems overall pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha K

customer_reviews.title: Excellect purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn't love their first tricycle?!? Easy to put together, holding up nice even when being chased by two furry sisters!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Bike
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy this bike again it was so disappointing for my granddaughter. It doesn’t turn you can’t steer it and it’s very frustrating for a little kid
customer_reviews.author: Wanda J. Green

customer_reviews.title: Little traction
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for my toddler. The only issue I have is it being plastic there is no traction so at times it’s hard for her to go anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: my girl love it
customer_reviews.text: My girl is 3 years old and this is her first trike. She is big at her age, 40 pounds and 41inchs. This trick is just suit for her. It is easy to assemble. My baby has not know how to control the trike yet, but she love it. she tried long time and didn't want to ride off the trike . She let me put the trike beside her bed when she went to bed! The center of gravity is low and not easy to turn over. So it is safe for little kids. Happy to buy this trike for my girl.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Very cute!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my baby girl's second birthday knowing she'd probably be a little small for it. She can't quite reach the pedals, but it was easy enough to assemble, and is very cute in person. The only thing I don't really like is how slick the front tire is - hopefully it won't be too much of an issue for her to be able to grip the road when she's able to start pedaling herself around.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Hills

customer_reviews.title: Good for age
customer_reviews.text: This was not only a better price but better quality then the 3 wheel bikes sold at the local stores. It also has block peddles and back support to change for the kids size. Was purchased for a 2 yo child.
customer_reviews.author: j82

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Present - little large for 2 year old but think she will grow into by summer.
customer_reviews.author: Rita W.

customer_reviews.title: it’s perfect. Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Knocked a star off because the front wheel kind of slides when she drives it. But otherwise, it’s perfect. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: A. Severson

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy,  terrific trike!
customer_reviews.text: It had extra parts, fairly easy to put together. Great instructions! Illustrations of parts needed some color on the page.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for a two year old.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 3 1/2, 50th percentile for height, and can barely reach the pedals. But it's a cute little trike.
customer_reviews.author: groomer74

customer_reviews.title: Great Trike!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and my 3 year old daughter really likes it. It is sturdy & I love that it will grow with her!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The trike is a very good first bike for a child to learn how to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Fran P.

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for shorter kids
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her bike but I wish the pedal extenders actually made them thicker as well as wider. My daughter is 25th percentile height and can't reach them, yet.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter won't get off the trike
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my two year old granddaughter and she rides it all over the house all the time. She "goes to the market" and brings home "groceries". She doesn't just ride it outside. She also used another trike at someone's house and it tipped over - this one does not do that, it's very stable. And it doesn't scratch indoor floors. Which in our case is important. So I am totally happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Cool Little Bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my grand daughter. At first she didn't really use the pedals in June. But by September she got the hang of it she loves it now.
customer_reviews.author: Wymetra Clow

customer_reviews.title: Above Average 2 Year Can't Reach Pedals
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old is in the 75th percentile for height and can't reach the pedals on this....she can reach when sitting still, but once she attempts to rotate the pedals, one of them becomes too far away even with the seat set as close as possible. The product is listed for ages 2-5 but it's a bit too big for the younger ones in that range in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Burgoyne

customer_reviews.title: Good for tall toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my very tall (99th percentile) 3 year old. She needs the blocks on the pedals now, but I know this trike will work for at least another summer, if not two.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived in perfect condition however most of the nuts/bolts/scews were missing. Complained to Amazon and they are making right right by sending us a new one. So we will see if parts arrive in the new box. However quality you get what you paid for just plastic. Another complaint there was large 'warning' stickers right now the trike not sure who to remove these with out that sticky stuff left behind.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnna

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is tricky.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful not to tighten the forks and steering column too tight or it's too hard to pedal and turn. The plastic won't be flush, but the kids will be able to actually maneuver the trike. Other than that, it's a great little trike.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter trike...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this trike as a Christmas gift for my 4 year old granddaughter and she loves it. I also ordered the blue one for my grandson and it was $10.00 cheaper than this one, and both trikes are identical except for the color. The price difference is why I rated this 4 stars. My dad and I put both trikes together in about an hour and even though they are mostly plastic construction, the quality seems to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond Dazzle

customer_reviews.title: Better as a ride-on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought the pedal blocks would make it easier for my daughter to pedal. Since the whole thing is plastic, my daughter gets upset because she pedals and the front wheel just turns and turns without grabbing the ground to move forward. She ends up using it more as a ride-on. I ended up buying her another trike that had real tires.
customer_reviews.author: MOM2LNE

customer_reviews.title: She loves it. As soon as she saw it ...
customer_reviews.text: She loves it. As soon as she saw it she knew it was all hers. She might have to use her feet to scoot right now until she can reach, but it will last for years and was worth every single dime (not that there were many) for this toy. It gets used daily inside and outside. Again, She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine 👸🏼

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loved it!! She can't reach the pedals yet but she'll grow into it. My 4 year old uses it more lol
customer_reviews.author: zach navar

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter LOVES her trike! Super easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.author: TexasSweetheart

customer_reviews.title: not bad, but think what you want
customer_reviews.text: nothing bad with the trike. I wish I had bought the one with pole/hand at the back so I dont have to bend much often when my kid rides it
customer_reviews.author: Spant002

customer_reviews.title: my daugther loves her tricecle but is still to big ...
customer_reviews.text: my daugther loves her tricecle but is still to big for her, thats why i dint give it a five stars review, she pushes her self around with her feet and at least is practicing the stearing so when she grows into it she will be a pro driver :)
customer_reviews.author: L. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose and appropriately priced
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old daughter loves it. Even woth the pedal attachments though she still cannot get a full turn but once she grows into it will be great. Fairly priced and was on time for a easter gift from the easter bunny 🐰
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great starter tric!
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, girly colors, sturdy foundation! My one year old daughter scoots around on this all day. She is a little big for her age but she will still be able to grow with this!
customer_reviews.author: Juss Tae

customer_reviews.title: A little big for a 24 month old
customer_reviews.text: Cute, appears to be good quality so far. Got it for our daughters second birthday and even with everything adjusted for her she still can't reach the peddles and she's on the tall side. However, she has fun riding it all around the house like a ride on toy so even though she can't use it for a bike yet it still gets use
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, easy to put together, and our daughter loves it! It’s bigger than we thought it would be, but that’s a good thing knowing she won’t grow out of it in a year
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice trike for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The steering column is so stiff our 2 and 1/2 year old granddaughter can't steer it. We are going to have to take it apart and see if we can shave down part of the plastic to make it turn easier. Maybe after some use it will get better. Other than not being able to steer, she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this trike. She can’t reach the pedals quite yet but she sure can make this lite weight trike move at lightning speed making grandma run after her. She is 2 years 3 month.
customer_reviews.author: Kari L Stimac

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together-Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old daughter's birthday. It was pretty easy to put together. I only needed a Phillips screw driver. Took me about 30 mins total. Her legs aren't strong enough to actually push the pedals and move it herself, but in time it will. She is happy scooting around on it or having someone push her. For the price, it's definitely worth it! Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: M. Walker446

customer_reviews.title: I would love to buy a assembled cycle instead of it
customer_reviews.text: The product was complicated to assemble it and there were some scratches present in the item. If it would have got assembled then it would be difficult to dismantle it. I would love to buy a assembled cycle instead of it. Also the cycle is too big for a 2 yr old kid.
customer_reviews.author: Vikrant Jain

customer_reviews.title: Wait until your child is big enough for a normal ...
customer_reviews.text: Wait until your child is big enough for a normal big wheel and buy that instead of this one that even older children cannot operate.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: The description said used but it was in great condition!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this! The description said used but it was in great condition!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Kinser

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trike
customer_reviews.text: Very nice - easy to assemble. Unfortunately my granddaughter was still too young to ride, but should be ready in about 6 months. Nice to see this item will grow with her.
customer_reviews.author: V-Pops

customer_reviews.title: the kids like it and it was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: the kids like it and it was easy to put together, in my opinion, it's probably better for over 3 year olds or older.
customer_reviews.author: Idelia Valencia

customer_reviews.title: 3-1/2 year old can't reach the pedals.
customer_reviews.text: Quality-wise this is pretty good. Nothing spectacular, but no real issues. It was easy to put together and seems it will last a few years. That's important since our 3 year old daughter couldn't use it this past summer. We got this for her 3rd birthday in June, but even now (December) she can't reach the pedals. She's short (34 inches) for her age, but certainly not shorter than a 2 year old and the listing says this is for 2-5 years. Once she is able to reach the pedals and properly use this, I don't foresee any other problems. It's a good buy overall, but take the sizing and your child's height into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Should I Buy That?

customer_reviews.title: The rock and roll bike by Fisher Price seems to be the best one they make
customer_reviews.text: Very thin plastic here. Not made very well. Pedals seem hard to reach -for my 4 year old. I wish I could return it- but it's already assembled. The rock and roll bike by Fisher Price seems to be the best one they make.
customer_reviews.author: Rv chick

customer_reviews.title: pretty trike
customer_reviews.text: Really good for the price. I don't see a 24month riding it. Our 38" tall 3yr old has to stretch pretty good to peddle. I put a small amount of vegetable oil between the moving parts to move freely.
customer_reviews.author: jewels

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2.5 year old daughter for Christmas. She is very tall, always in the 90th percentile for height. She can hardly reach the pedals, even with the blocks. She will be 3 in two months and can just reach now but slips off often...
customer_reviews.author: LyAnne

customer_reviews.title: Love this trike
customer_reviews.text: Love this trike! Even my 6 year old rides it. bought it for my 2 year old but she's still not ready for it. She still uses it though without pedaling. Its so cute!
customer_reviews.author: kitkatdubs

customer_reviews.title: Loved the bike we gave to our granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: Loved the bike we gave to our granddaughter. She was able to easily sit on the seat and move the bike with her feet. (Didn't know how to pedal yet)
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Plastic junk
customer_reviews.text: plastic is one thing but when it is hard to roll because no bearings in it is just sad. The front wheel petal shaft is just run through the plastic on the forks so its hard to petal and if pushed on hard floor or outside the front wheel scoots instead of rolling
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent First Trike
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my granddaughter's 2nd birthday, and it was just perfect. The colors are exactly right for a little girl, and the helmet was a good match. She was thrilled! We love the fact that it is adjustable, and also that it was very easy to assemble. I would reccommend this without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: SWFLainey

customer_reviews.title: Grow with me Tricycle
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old daughter just loves the trike. Some assembly required but only took me about 10 minutes to complete. After that, it is all fun for her. The pedal extenders are wonderful and helps my daughter use the pedals. All plastic so I could see on how it may slip on some surfaces, but we don't have that issue. A good toy at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: ultra55371d

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I wanted , easy assembly, Granddaughter loves it
customer_reviews.author: larry b clark

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old loves the trike, it only ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves the trike, it only took us 15 minutes to put it together and she was on it right away. She can't reach the pedals, but im sure she will in a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: nanc01

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this purchase at all
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are so slick that they have no traction, the tension on the handle bars is so tight that it is hard for the child to turn it. A average size three year old can barely reach the pedals even though the blocks are on it. Not happy with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: more horses

customer_reviews.title: Works for a first trike
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves it. It's light enough for her to maneuver. The design is great for toddlers that aren't quite tall enough (or coordinated enough) for a regular bike.
customer_reviews.author: Noa

customer_reviews.title: Too big for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: It says 2-5 years, and we got it for our two year old. Even with the added block, it's too big and she can't push it. Probably would've gotten something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea LaTulippe

customer_reviews.title: Trike
customer_reviews.text: Great idea how it can grow with the child, but the wheel has no traction and slides in place most of the time when my daughter tries to ride it. Guess we will be looking for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: I would do zero stars if possible. Wish we ...
customer_reviews.text: I would do zero stars if possible. Wish we had kept the box so I could return it! Wheel barely turns, hard to petal, and when petaling the child must use a lot of force to get it moving. Amazon has failed me again
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Yes this product is as described and met my expectations very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together but need to review the suggested age range.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty sturdy and easy to assemble. The only real downside is that it indicates it's for ages 2-5 but neither of my 2 1/2 yr old twins can actually peddle it (feet reach but only with legs extended) with the seat in the closer position and the extra peddle blocks on. I think it will be good for them when they get bigger but with the age range listed, I really expected to put these to use sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus Killeen

customer_reviews.title: The bike is well built and sturdy. I expect it will grow with her really ...
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 year old can't reach the pedals yet, even with the blocks on them, but she absolutely loves this bike. It's high enough that she can use her feet to scoot around on it. The bike is well built and sturdy. I expect it will grow with her really well!
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: It is really nicely made and not too bad to put together
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my granddaughter. It is really nicely made and not too bad to put together!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Hesch

customer_reviews.title: Great tricycle. But a little hard for the kids ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tricycle. But a little hard for the kids to reach pedals even with the blocks on. My grand daughter is almost three and really can’t pedal it well. Probably best age is 3 and up.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Waltemath

customer_reviews.title: Grow with Me Trike - Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This trike was the perfect gift. We bought two for our grandaughters ages 28mo. and 18 mo., they loved them and could just about reach the pedals with the extenders on them. It was so easy to put together too. I was able to put both of them together in less that 1 hour! I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: She will have to wait until she is 3 to get good use out of it
customer_reviews.text: it's cute, but it's too big for my above average height 2 year old. She will have to wait until she is 3 to get good use out of it. I wish it had the handle on the back so i could push it, but what do you expect for the price?
customer_reviews.author: u170who

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: Product is defective, the parts were not cut out correctly and the pedals are difficult to turn because of poor manufacturing
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 13-month old granddaughter for Christmas. Even adjusting it as small as possible, it's too big for her, which I expected. Should be perfect by spring when it's warm enough to take outside. She loves it and likes to be pushed on it for now. The trike is high quality and cute as can be.
customer_reviews.author: luv2run

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is 2 and 1/2 in it was a little bit too big
customer_reviews.author: Tressia

customer_reviews.title: Another excellent product by Fisher Price!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our daughter who's 2. She needs to grow a couple inches before she can ride pushing the peddles, but right now she loves just pushing herself with her feet on the ground! Great bike that was easy to assemble as well.
customer_reviews.author: Angela J. Findle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My, extremely tall (3 ft, 2 inches) 3 year old loves this bike!
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Trike
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike but definitely for an older child. We bought this for our 2 year old grandaughter in May and she still can't reach the pedals!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for toddler girls
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product, my 2 year old daughter loves it. Only challenge - she cannot use the wheel pedals as she can't reach them (she is 32" tall). Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Raj Singh

customer_reviews.title: Horrible packaging and tricycle looks used.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible packing. Tricycle looks used and the original packaging had holes everywhere and looks like if the tricycle had been used before. It was for a gift, I'm even ashame to give that as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this trike for my 2 year old granddaughter's birthday. She is still a little short on reaching the pedals, even with the blocks, but can make it go with her feet...and she will grow in to it. It is very well made, and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2-y-o niece for Christmas. My brother-in-law assembled it within 7 minutes. I wish it came with additional pedal extenders, as the todder's legs are not quite long enough, but she'll grow into it. Cute color.
customer_reviews.author: DLS

customer_reviews.title: Great Trike! Slightly too big
customer_reviews.text: The only spiff we have is my daughter can't reach the peddles. She solved it easly enough she just uses her feet like her cozy coupe! It will be great for her to grow into. Took about 30 minutes to put together and seems pretty sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Kyra Juliano

customer_reviews.title: she loves it
customer_reviews.text: Puts together easily. Got it for my 2 year old's birthday. She is taller than average, but she is still a bit too short to reach the pedals. That's fine, she will grow into it, and still enjoys it all the same.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble, doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: One of the pedals is locked up and won't turn. It was hard to put together and it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny M. Russell

product_meta.title: Fisher-Price Grow-with-Me Trike - R0322
product_meta.description:
The Fisher-Price Grow-With-Me Trike has a two-position adjustable seat and removable pedal blocks that let it “grow” with your child for years of fun and adventure! Toddler friendly features like a wide wheel base for stability, slip-resistant pedals, easy-grip handlebars and durable tires are perfect for young riders! And the adorable pink and purple styling adds to the smiles – mile after mile!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Two-position adjustable seat lets this trike “grow” with kids for years of fun and adventure! With a wide wheel base for stability, slip-resistant pedals and easy-grip handlebars, and durable tires for miles of smiles.
feature_bullets: Two-position adjustable seat for growing kids!
Removable pedal blocks for easy foot-to-pedal adjustment

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars445 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
